Article Title: SC seeks government stand on plea for court-monitored ADAG probe
Article Text: NEW DELHI: Supreme Court Tuesday entertained a PIL accusing Anil Dhirubhai Ambani Group (ADAG) companies of committing "one of the largest corporate frauds" by siphoning an estimated Rs 40,000 crore from banks through loans, and seeking a court-monitored probe by CBI and ED into the allegations, reports Dhananjay Mahapatra.After briefly hearing advocate Prashant Bhushan, who appeared for petitioner E A S Sarma, a bench of CJI Bhushan R Gavai and Justice K Vinod Chandran sought responses from the central govt, CBI, ED and Anil Ambani. When Bhushan requested Supreme Court to seek a probe status report from CBI and ED, the SC bench said it would be considered after receiving their responses.The petition alleged that ADAG companies - Reliance Communications (RCOM), Reliance Infratel (RITL) and Reliance Telecom (RTL) - had cumulatively received loans to the tune of Rs 31,850 crore from a consortium of public sector banks led by State Bank of India between 2013 and 2017.
Article Summary: Supreme court tuesday entertained a pil accusing anil dhirubhai ambani group (adag) companies of committing "one of the largest corporate frauds" the petition alleged that adag companies received loans to the tune of rs 31,850 crore from a consortium of public sector banks.

Article Title: Did ESPN’s new deal push 75 NCAA gymnastics teams out of the spotlight? The airtime schedule explains the full story
Article Text:
KJ Johnson and NCAA Gymnastics trophy (via Getty Images)

SEC’s new TV deal with ESPN creates a major divide in the NCAA gymnastics



The Southeastern Conference (SEC) has changed the NCAA gymnastics broadcast picture with its latest 2026 announcement. Every SEC program will receive full-season coverage across ESPN networks. This means fans across the country will see SEC teams every week, while most other NCAA programs get little to no national exposure. The change creates a clear visibility gap even before the season begins.The opening schedule reveals the imbalance right away. The 2026 season starts with the Sprouts Farmers Market Collegiate Quad on ABC and ESPN2 on January 10. After that, SEC teams dominate the national broadcast windows on ESPN2 and SEC Network from mid-January to late February. Even top programs outside the SEC, such as Oklahoma, appear far less. As the season moves forward, non-SEC teams get only scattered opportunities to be on national television.The SEC’s expanded TV coverage may have a profound impact on the NCAA gymnastics. The conference now has full-season national exposure that no other league comes close to. ESPN and the SEC Network provide strong production, wide reach, and prime-time slots.This gives SEC athletes more chances to be seen by fans, scouts, and sponsors.Even Oklahoma, one of the sport’s most successful programs, highlights the contrast. The Sooners announced eight nationally televised meets for 2026. It is a strong lineup, but it still does not match the SEC’s season-long coverage. Five of Oklahoma’s regular-season meets will air on the SEC Network, yet their non-SEC opponents will not get the same visibility. This leaves most programs across the country with limited national airtime.This imbalance could impact recruiting. Since more TV time can also help athletes grow their NIL value. When athletes appear regularly on ESPN platforms, brands notice. More viewers also means stronger social media followings.The NCAA Championships will still air on ESPN+, ESPN2, and ABC. The NCAA Championship Preview Show and the NCAA Championship final on April 18, 2026, will also air on ABC. But the SEC Network remains the main home for Friday Night Heights.The long-term concern is whether non-SEC athletes will lose opportunities. Less TV time can mean fewer sponsors, weaker recruiting power, and slower program growth. The SEC’s broadcast strength may lift its teams even higher while others struggle to keep up.Also Read: Simone Biles drops jaw-dropping $90K flex on Chicago Bears sidelines while celebrating husband Jonathan Owens’ win
Article Summary: The southeastern conference (sec) has changed the ncaa gymnastics broadcast picture with its latest 2026 announcement. Every sec program will receive full-season coverage across espn networks. This means fans across the country will see sec teams every week, while most other ncaa programs get little to no national exposure.

Article Title: Lava Agni 4 launches on November 20: Price, camera, processor and other expected features
Article Text:
Lava Agni 4 expected features

Design & Build

Lava Play Ultra 5G Review: Smooth Gameplay on a Budget

Processor & performance

Display

Camera System

Durability & Protection

Customization

Agni Promise





Lava is all set to expand its smartphone category in India with the launch of Agni 4. The handset is expected to be a mid-range device which may be priced below Rs 30,000. Ahead of the launch, Lava has announced a Demo@Home campaign where it facilitates the visit of a Lava engineer to homes of interested buyers. They will help them walkthrough the device and try out the device's design and capabilities. It is an invite-only campaign and will run from November 20 to November 24, in Bengaluru, Delhi, and Mumbai. Before launch, the rumour mill has been buzzing with expected features of Lava Agni 4. Here’s what we know so farThe phone comes with an aluminium alloy frame, a matte AG glass back, and 1.7 mm slim bezels. It is available in Phantom Black and Lunar Mist White. The company says the design improves durability and in-hand comfort.It runs on the MediaTek Dimensity 8350 5G chip (4nm, up to 3.35GHz). The device scores more than 1.4 million on AnTuTu (V10). It uses LPDDR5X RAM and UFS 4.0 storage. The model includes 8GB RAM, expandable to 16GB, and 256GB storage. A 4300 mm² vapor-chamber cooling system and a Game Booster mode are also included.The phone features a 6.67-inch 1.5K AMOLED screen with a 120Hz refresh rate and peak brightness of 2400 nits.It offers 10-bit colour depth, 446 PPI and 1.07 billion colours. The display is tuned for better visibility under strong outdoor light.The rear setup has a 50MP primary camera with OIS and an 8MP ultra-wide lens. The front camera is 50MP. Both front and rear cameras support 4K video recording at 60fps. The device includes AI scene and skin-tone adjustments, Dual Conversion Gain for better dynamic range, Dual-View Video and Document Correction.The phone has a reinforced frame, carries an IP64 rating for dust and splash resistance, and can withstand up to an hour of rainfall. It uses Corning Gorilla Glass and supports wet-touch operation.A programmable Action Key offers more than 100 shortcut options through short press, double press or long press.– Doorstep replacement for manufacturing defects– No bloatware– Three years of Android updates and four years of security updates– Ongoing software improvements
Article Summary: Lava is all set to expand its smartphone category in india with the launch of agni 4. The handset is expected to be a mid-range device which may be priced below rs 30,000. Lava has announced a demo@home campaign where it facilitates the visit of a lava engineer to homes of interested buyers.

Article Title: ‘We've proudly called Texas home for 15 years’, says Google CEO Sundar Pichai announcing $40 billion investment in Texas
Article Text:
Google’s $40 billion investment in Texas

Google To Invest $15 Billion On AI Hub In Visakhapatnam, CEO Sundar Pichai Speaks To PM Modi





Google has announced a $40 billion investment in Texas through 2027, marking one of its largest US infrastructure commitments to date. The funds, the company said will go toward building new cloud and AI infrastructure, including new data center campuses in Armstrong County and Haskell County. Google CEO shared an online post, announcing the investment. “Today, we're announcing a new $40B investment in Texas through 2027 to build Cloud & AI infrastructure and support thousands of new jobs,” he wrote in the post.“This includes new data centers in Armstrong and Haskell Counties and a major investment to strengthen energy resilience and abundance. We're also providing funding to more than double the projected pipeline of new Texan electricians to power the AI era,” he added.“We've proudly called Texas home for 15 years. Thank you @GregAbbott_TX for your continued support,” Pichai continued.As part of the $40 billion investment, Google said it will continue its approach of growing infrastructure responsibly, which includes adding new clean energy resources to the Texas grid and covering the costs tied to its operations. The company also announced a new $30 million Energy Impact Fund to help scale community energy-efficiency projects across the state.Google also confirmed it has secured more than 6,200 megawatts of new energy generation and capacity through power-purchase agreements with energy developers. One of the new Haskell County data centers will be built alongside a solar and battery storage plant, reinforcing the company’s push toward cleaner, more reliable energy resources.In order to support construction of the new facilities, Google will help expand Texas’ pool of skilled electrical workers. In partnership with the electrical training ALLIANCE, the company will help train existing electricians and more than 1,700 apprentices by 2030, more than doubling the state’s expected pipeline of new electricians.Google said the investment is meant not only to bolster Texas’ workforce and infrastructure, but to help ensure the U.S. maintains “the technical backbone to lead the world in AI."
Article Summary: Google has announced a $40 billion investment in texas through 2027. The funds, the company said will go toward building new cloud and ai infrastructure. The company also announced a new $30 million energy impact fund to help scale community energy-efficiency projects across the state.

Article Title: Cloudflare CTO Dane Knecht says: This was not an attack, that issue ...
Article Text:
CTO Dane Knecht apologies for Cloudflare outage



Cloudflare down: OpenAI, Twitter, Spotify, Canva, Claude and other big businesses that Cloudflare outage 'disrupted'

I won’t mince words: earlier today we failed our customers and the broader Internet when a problem in @Cloudflare network impacted large amounts of traffic that rely on us. The sites, businesses, and organizations that rely on Cloudflare depend on us being available and I apologize for the impact that we caused.

Transparency about what happened matters, and we plan to share a breakdown with more details in a few hours. In short, a latent bug in a service underpinning our bot mitigation capability started to crash after a routine configuration change we made. That cascaded into a broad degradation to our network and other services. This was not an attack.

That issue, impact it caused, and time to resolution is unacceptable. Work is already underway to make sure it does not happen again, but I know it caused real pain today. The trust our customers place in us is what we value the most and we are going to do what it takes to earn that back.

Cloudflare monitoring issues after applying fix







The major service disruption that rendered ChatGPT, Twitter, Spotify, Canva, Claude, and numerous other platforms unreachable on Tuesday (November 18) has been restored. Cloudflare CTO Dane Knecht confirmed that the technical problems have been addressed. The internet infrastructure provider deployed its corrective measures that prompted affected services to begin returning to normal operation shortly thereafter. While the primary issues have been resolved, Cloudflare continues to actively monitor the situation and has indicated that users may still experience occasional difficulties.In a long post on X (formerly Twitter), Knecht apologised for the outage, saying that a bug caused a cascade of failures, rendering hundreds of websites offline. In a separate post, he confirmed that the issue has been resolved. Read CTO Dane Knecht’s full post:Cloudflare has updated its status page saying that it has fixed the issue but is monitoring the situation for services to be fully back online.“A fix has been implemented and we believe the incident is now resolved. We are continuing to monitor for errors to ensure all services are back to normal,” the company said.At the time of writing, the company said, “We continue to see errors and latency improve but still have reports of intermittent errors. The team continues to monitor the situation as it improves, and looking for ways to accelerate full recovery.”
Article Summary: Cto dane knecht apologies for cloudflare outage on tuesday. He says a bug caused a cascade of failures, rendering hundreds of websites offline. Cto confirms that the technical problems have been addressed. While the primary issues have been resolved, cloud flare continues to actively monitor the situation.

Article Title: Cloudflare outage: Cloudflare fixes outage that took down the internet: How social media reacted to the outage that took down Spotify, ChatGPT and hundreds of other websites
Article Text:
AI generated image for representation

Cloudflare

Cloudflare down: OpenAI, Twitter, Spotify, Canva, Claude and other big businesses that Cloudflare outage 'disrupted'

How social media reacted to the Cloudflare outage



“THE CLOUDFLARE COLLAPSE BY NUMBERS:

- 11,000+ reports in USA (first hour)

ERROR TYPES REPORTED:

SERVICES DOWN:

- Canva - Can't design

THE SCARY PART:

Internet dependency on Cloudflare:

One company

Multiple failure points

Zero geographic isolation

Cascade effect to dependent services

This wasn't a small incident.

This was a SYSTEMIC FAILURE that exposed how fragile internet infrastructure is.

When will we decentralize?

cc

@Cloudflare

#CloudflareDown #InternetOutage”

“> checks if cloudflare is down

> they use cloudflare”

“Cloudflare went down early this morning, causing half the internet to go offline. Major platforms like Twitter/X, ChatGPT (OpenAI), Spotify, Facebook, Telegram, League of Legends, Letterboxd, and others were affected.”

“When you f**k the whole internet so hard, that even your CSS on your status page don't work anymore.

Cloudflare DOWN

!”

Cloudflare is down

Engineers rn…”





, which helps many websites work, faced a major outage today(November 18). However, the IT infrastructure company has now fixed the problem that prevented people from using many online services. This problem lasted for more than 2 hours and affected popular sites such as X (Twitter), ChatGPT, Spotify, Discord, and Canva. Many people couldn't use these services, underscoring how important Cloudflare is to the internet's functioning. When the internet was down, people turned to social media to discuss how the outage affected them. They were confused and annoyed that they couldn't get access to several websites. These kinds of problems from major internet companies show how dependent online services are on Cloudflare. The company says the fix is in place and it is checking to make sure everything is back to normal. Meanwhile, here are a few social media posts that were shared on X during the outage that went viral:A X user named KuroukaRun shared the important numbers of the Cloudflare outage. The user wrote:Another user named Parsa shared how the Cloudflare outage took down Downdetector, the website that tracks which websites are down. The user wrote:A third user named Fear Buck shared screenshots of the error message shown by several sites and wrote:A fourth user wrote:A fifth user shared a meme about the outage and wrote:
Article Summary: Cloudflare went down early this morning, causing half the internet to go offline. Major platforms like twitter/x, chatgpt (openai), spotify, facebook, telegram, league of legends, letterboxd, and others were affected. Many people couldn't use these services, underscoring how important cloudflare is to the internet's functioning.

Article Title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy advocates 72-hour work week; wants young Indians to follow China's banned '996' rule: "No country has progressed without..."
Article Text: Infosys founder N.R. Narayana Murthy has reignited India's work culture debate, advocating for a 72-hour workweek by citing China's controversial '996' schedule. This practice, where employees work 9 AM to 9 PM, six days a week, was declared illegal in China in 2021 due to burnout. Murthy's call has drawn sharp criticism from Indian workers, who point to issues like punishing commutes, rising costs, and the need for competitive salaries over extended hours.
Article Summary: Infosys founder n.r. Narayana murthy has called for a 72-hour workweek. He cited china's controversial '996' schedule, where employees work 9 am to 9 pm, six days a week. This practice was declared illegal in china in 2021 due to burnout.

Article Title: Cloudflare down: Twitter, ChatGPT and hundreds of other websites facing disruption
Article Text:
AI generated image for representation

Update:

Cloudflare

says that a fix has be implemented and the issue should resolve soon. In a message on its status page, the company wrote: "A fix has been implemented and we believe the incident is now resolved. We are continuing to monitor for errors to ensure all services are back to normal."

Original story follows

Cloudflare down: OpenAI, Twitter, Spotify, Canva, Claude and other big businesses that Cloudflare outage 'disrupted'

"Please unblock challenges.cloudflare.com to proceed,"

What Cloudflare said about the server outage





"Cloudflare is aware of, and investigating an issue which impacts multiple customers: Widespread 500 errors, Cloudflare Dashboard and API also failing. We are working to understand the full impact and mitigate this problem.

More updates to follow shortly."

"We are seeing services recover, but customers may continue to observe higher-than-normal error rates as we continue remediation efforts. We are continuing to investigate this issue."

List of website affected by Cloudflare outage

Twitter (X)

Spotify

Canva

Shopify

OpenAI

Garmin

Claude

Verizon

Discord

TMobile

AT&T

League of Legends

(Developing story)





Users of several popular websites, including X (formerly Twitter) and OpenAI ’s ChatGPT, have reported facing issues. The content delivery network provider, Cloudflare, is causing this multi-platform disruption. The company’s official status page has also confirmed the ongoing service degradation. According to the outage-tracking website Downdetector, the disruption began around 6:00 AM ET (4.30 pm IST) when an issue with Cloudflare's support portal provider surfaced, quickly spreading to broader service problems. Users trying to access affected sites are encountering difficulties, such as being unable to load posts on X, to use design tools like Canva and chatbots like ChatGPT, or to access specific online games like League of Legends.In many cases, users attempting to reach these websites have reported being blocked by a generic message, such aswhich prevents access to the protected site. This message indicates that the security and challenge systems provided by Cloudflare are malfunctioning, even though the underlying websites themselves may remain operational.The current downtime is tied directly to the issues Cloudflare is experiencing with its systems.The provider's role in delivering content and managing security challenges means its operational status impacts a wide range of internet services that rely on its network infrastructure.In its official status page, Cloudflare initially wrote:Later on, the company shared:Cloudflare sits behind a substantial portion of the modern internet. It powers content delivery, security protections and tools that keep websites online during traffic spikes or cyber attacks. When its systems fail, the impact ripples far beyond any single service. This time was no different. A wide range of unrelated websites appeared to go down at the same moment, echoing the scale of last month's AWS outage.As Cloudflare provides DNS, CDN, and DDoS protection for thousands of businesses, the outage had a cascading effect. Among the most notable disruptions:
Article Summary: Users of several popular websites, including x (formerly twitter) and openai ’s chatgpt, have reported facing issues. The content delivery network provider, cloudflare, is causing this multi-platform disruption. A wide range of unrelated websites appeared to go down at the same moment, echoing the scale of last month's aws outage.

Article Title: Who is John Ternus, and why he is the leading candidate to succeed Tim Cook as Apple CEO
Article Text: Apple is preparing for a leadership change. Tim Cook may step down as CEO next year. John Ternus, senior vice president of hardware engineering, is reportedly the leading candidate. The company's board and executives are intensifying transition preparations. This move is not linked to current performance. An announcement could come early next year. Ternus, 50, could lead Apple for a decade. He is well-regarded and trusted by Cook. Apple faces challenges in AI and new technologies.
Article Summary: Tim cook may step down as ceo next year. John ternus, senior vice president of hardware engineering, is reportedly the leading candidate. The company's board and executives are intensifying transition preparations. This move is not linked to current performance.

Article Title: A room full of startup founders and investors at the world's biggest AI conference votes ChatGPT-maker OpenAI among 'likely flops'
Article Text:
Representative Image

Why AI professionals are thinking that OpenAI may turn out to be a ‘flop’





OpenAI's Master Plan for India

"How can a company with $13 billion in revenues make $1.4 trillion of spend commitments?"

"If you want to sell your shares, I'll find you a buyer. Enough,”

"Geeze, it sounds more like the judgmental valley conference."





ChatGPT maker OpenAI was voted among the startups with potential to 'FAIL' in an informal survey at the Cerebral Valley AI Conference. The result offers an unexpected perspective on the ChatGPT maker that has $100-plus valuation. The survey asked founders and investors which AI startup they would be willing to bet against, a question not typically raised so openly in Silicon Valley. AI search startup Perplexity received the most votes, followed by ChatGPT-maker OpenAI. Meanwhile, when the audience was asked whether they could invest in any private technology company, most people voted for the Claude maker Anthropic, while OpenAI took second place.According to a Business Insider report, independent journalist Eric Newcomer conducted the survey by gathering responses from more than 300 attendees before panels featuring other major AI companies, such as Anthropic and xAI. This shows that some industry professionals are becoming more cautious about the success of AI startups. Even with a lot of money going into AI, there is now some doubt about how well certain big companies in the field will do.OpenAI taking second place on the list may seem unexpected because it is often viewed as a consumer-focused leader in the AI space. However, its rapidly rising valuation and significant infrastructure costs have raised concerns for some investors. Even though Sam Altman has acknowledged the possibility of an AI bubble, OpenAI CEO rejected the idea that his company’s valuation is overstated during a recent conversation with investor Brad Gerstner.Gerstner asked Altman at the interview.Altman replied.Altman noted that interest in the company remains strong. In fact, both OpenAI and Perplexity were popular choices in another part of the survey that asked which companies respondents would be willing to bet on.Perplexity, which also offers an AI-powered search browser, is aiming to compete with Google, and being ranked first on the list is not unexpected.Perplexity has become a typical example in discussions about the possibility of an AI bubble, as it has raised frequent funding rounds and attracted strong investor interest at valuations reported to range from $14 billion to $50 billion, according to the report.When asked about the Cerebral Valley survey, Perplexity spokesperson Jesse Dwyer responded in an email:However, it's important to note that any informal, anonymous survey should be viewed cautiously. Yet, the results offer insight into private opinions, as many founders and investors discuss concerns about an AI bubble but rarely mention specific companies.Unlike public markets, private investors do not typically bet against startups, and openly criticising a company without clear justification is generally discouraged in Silicon Valley.
Article Summary: Chatgpt maker openai was voted among the startups with potential to 'fail' in an informal survey at the cerebral valley ai conference. The survey asked founders and investors which ai startup they would be willing to bet against. Ai search startup perplexity received the most votes, followed by chatgpt-maker openai.

Article Title: Buy or sell: Stock recommendation by brokers for November 19, 2025
Article Text: Jefferies has initiated its coverage of WeWork India with a buy rating and a target price of Rs 790. Analysts said that the company is the largest flexible workspace operator by revenues in India. At about 17% compounded annual growth rate (CAGR), flexible workspace stock is growing at two times the pace of office stock, with room for further penetration.They said WeWork's premium positioning helps command higher average revenue per member and margins than peers.Motilal Oswal Securities has initiated its coverage of PB Fintech with a neutral rating and a target price of Rs 2,000. Analysts expect PB Fintech to post a strong FY25-FY28 revenue, earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation, and amortisation (EBITDA) and profit after tax (PAT) CAGR of 35%, 156% and 56%, respectively, after factoring in a strengthening position in under-penetrated credit and insurance industries. However, they believe the stock is fairly valued, and all positives are priced in at current levels. Any possibility of commission restructuring by insurance companies due to the loss of input tax credit post GST exemption poses a key risk for the company’s top-line growth.Morgan Stanley has an overweight rating on Eternal (formerly Zomato) with the target price at Rs 427. They believe Eternal has the best risk-reward matrix and investors would use the current weakness to accumulate the stock. Like Eternal's strategy of doubling down on customer market share as wallet share expansion can follow later. Theyassume a stress case of higher aggression could mean push out of profitability but this is not a game changer.They are assuming a stress case scenario where the stock would bottom out at Rs 280 - Rs 285.UBS has a buy rating on Max Healthcare Institute with the target price at Rs 1,550. Analysts expect the company’s brownfield capacity addition to drive growth and earnings. The management said that it recently commissioned a Mohali facility including an oncology facility. It’s also commissioning a facility at Nanavati hospital inMumbai.Also the construction activity at other new hospitals is progressing well. The management indicated that the issues related to cashless service for insurance patients has been resolved and mentioned there was no/only limited impact as patients shift from insurance to cash in such instances.Nomura has a neutral rating on Oil India with the target price at Rs 430. Analysts said the company’s July-Sept quarter was a soft one as volumes were impacted by external factors. The expansion work at Numaligarh Refinery was on track, with first crude intake expected next month and a meaningful volume uptick by the July-Sept quarter ofnext year. Analysts cut Oil India's FY26 and FY27 profit estimates by 37% and 18%, respectively, to reflect: Lower gas sales volume, lower crude price realizations, higher depletion & depreciation expenses, and sharply higher exploratory write-offs and impairments.
Article Summary: Jefferies has initiated its coverage of wework india with a buy rating. Motilal oswal securities has initiated coverage of pb fintech with a neutral rating. Morgan stanley has an overweight rating on eternal (formerly zomato) with the target price at rs 427.

Article Title: 'New scam just dropped': Video of Indians in wheelchairs at airport on India-US route triggers row
Article Text:
A viral video shamed Indians claiming that they fake disability and book wheelchairs at foreign airports.



'No Talent In U.S.': Trump BURNS MAGA Base For India Reset? What It Means For Indian Workers





A video of long queues of wheelchair-bound people, visibly Indians, at some airport has triggered a massive social media controversy with Indians getting hate from all corners because of what social media users are calling "new scam". The viral post claimed Air India said 30% of passengers on India-US flights ask for wheelchairs and most of them are able-bodied travelers "scamming the priority boarding system" while those who really need a wheelchair don't get it.The same X account, claiming to be from Canada, posted another video of Indians "taking all the wheelchairs at airports". "If they are doing this at airports, do you think our elderly are being scammed by them in our healthcare system too?" the post read."If they do that to board, imagine what theyll scam once theyre here," one wrote.Indian entrepreneur Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw reacted to the viral video and suggested that wheelchair at airport should come at a cost. "They should charge an additional Rs 5000 per airport n then they will see how many genuine passengers there are!" Shaw wrote.Shaw received flak for amplifying India-hatred on X and her suggestion was called inconvenient for people who are not faking their disability. Also, many users pointed out that there is no evidence to prove that they were all faking it. One user claimed that it is not about walking at the airport but the process because of which Indians get wheelchairs for their parents as they don't know English. "It is not about walking it is about the process. Most indian parents don't know english and dont know where to go so their children book wheelchair so they can go to security clearance, terminal change and baggage collection area without tension," one wrote.
Article Summary: A viral video shamed indians claiming that they fake disability and book wheelchairs at foreign airports. A video of long queues of wheelchair-bound people, visibly indians, at some airport has triggered a massive social media controversy. The viral post claimed air india said 30% of passengers on india-us flights ask for wheelchairs.

Article Title: 'Heavy debt, rising costs': UK’s largest pub group to sell around thousand sites; eyes deal worth 1 billion pounds
Article Text:
Stonegate Group, the UK's largest pub operator, is reportedly considering selling approximately 1,000 of its most profitable "platinum" pubs for an estimated £1 billion. This move aims to address the company's substantial £3 billion debt burden. The sale of these separately structured sites would not impact the rest of Stonegate's extensive estate.





Stonegate Group, the UK’s largest pub operator and owner of chains including Slug & Lettuce and Be At One, is reportedly considering the sale of around 1,000 sites in a deal potentially worth 1 billion pounds, Independent reported.The move comes as the group seeks to address an estimated 3 billion pounds in accumulated debts.According to Independent, the sites under consideration form a portfolio of the group’s most profitable pubs, often described as its “platinum” collection. These pubs are structured as a separate entity within Stonegate, allowing a sale without affecting the rest of its estate of 4,300 sites. Executives are consulting advisers on options, including selling the pubs in smaller groups rather than in a single transaction.A Stonegate spokesperson told The Sun that no pubs are at risk of closure and all sites will continue to operate under the Stonegate brand. Analysts note that many UK pub chains remain under pressure, with several, such as Oakman Inns & Restaurants, entering administration earlier this year due to elevated costs and reduced revenue.Stonegate’s financial difficulties date back to its 2019 merger with rival company Ei, which left the group heavily indebted just months before the Covid-19 lockdown severely impacted the hospitality sector.Attempts to sell some sites in previous years were unsuccessful, and the group instead refinanced the platinum pubs with a 638 million pounds loan from private equity firm Apollo. The end of a non-call period on this loan in January could allow Stonegate to pursue a potential sale, The Independent reported.Chief executive David McDowall, who joined the company from BrewDog in 2023, had outlined a “transformation plan” to return Stonegate to profitability. Despite these measures, the company posted a 214 million pounds loss in 2024.The wider UK hospitality industry too continues to face challenges from high operating costs, rising energy and food prices, increased national insurance contributions, and the ongoing impact of the Covid-19 pandemic on customer spending.
Article Summary: Stonegate group, the uk's largest pub operator, is reportedly considering the sale of around 1,000 sites in a deal potentially worth 1 billion pounds. The move comes as the group seeks to address an estimated 3 billion pounds in accumulated debts. The sale of these separately structured sites would not impact the rest of stonegate's extensive estate.

Article Title: China emissions flat in third quarter as solar surges: Study
Article Text:
Representative image

Fujian Vs Ford: China Unveils Its Most Advanced Carrier, Reshaping Indo-Pacific Power Balance





PARIS: China's CO2 emissions remained flat in the third quarter as power generation from solar energy surged and electric car use continued to grow, a study showed on Tuesday.Emissions from the world's biggest polluter have now been flat or falling for 18 straight months, said the analysis published by climate news specialist Carbon Brief."After the first three quarters of the year, China's CO2 emissions in 2025 are now finely balanced between a small fall or rise, depending on what happens in the last quarter," said Lauri Myllyvirta, lead analyst at the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air."A drop in the full-year total became much more likely after September, which recorded an approximately three percent drop in emissions year-on-year," said Myllyvirta, who is also a senior fellow at the Asia Society Policy Institute.The new analysis, which is based on official Chinese data, comes as the UN's COP30 climate conference kicked off in Brazil on Monday."While an emission increase or decrease of one percent or less might not make a huge difference in an objective sense, it has heightened symbolic meaning," Myllyvirta said."China's policymakers have left room for emissions to increase for several more years, leaving the timing of the peak open," he added.Emissions from the power sector, China's dominant source of CO2, remained flat in the third quarter despite strong demand for electricity, Myllyvirta said.Electricity generation from solar energy rose 46 percent while wind grew 11 percent compared to the same period last year.Emissions from transport fuel dropped by five percent, with declines also in cement and steel production.Oil demand and emissions grew elsewhere by 10 percent as the production of plastics and other chemicals surged, the analysis found.In September, China issued its first-ever absolute targets for cutting planet-warming gases.Under the new plan, China will reduce economy-wide emissions by seven to 10 percent by 2035 relative to the year of the country's peak emissions, believed to be 2025.China had previously pledged to peak its carbon output before 2030 and achieve carbon neutrality by 2060, without ever previously setting near-term numerical targets for total emissions reductions.
Article Summary: Emissions from the world's biggest polluter have now been flat or falling for 18 straight months. Power generation from solar energy surged and electric car use continued to grow. Oil demand and emissions grew elsewhere by 10 percent as the production of plastics and other chemicals surged.

Article Title: Emirates to roll out free Starlink Wi-Fi with full streaming and connectivity on all flights by 2027
Article Text:
Stay connected at 35,000 feet: Emirates brings free Starlink Wi-Fi to every flight/Image: Emirates

Starlink rollout plan and fleet coverage

Features and passenger experience





Stream movies, TV shows, and other media

Play online games

Conduct video calls

Work seamlessly

Browse social media

Access content on both personal devices and seatback screens simultaneously

Strategic vision and industry impact





Brand-new Premium Economy cabins

Enhanced Business Class suites

Refreshed First Class cabins

Upgraded entertainment system technologies

A transformative upgrade for passengers









Emirates is set to transform inflight connectivity with Starlink Wi-Fi across its entire fleet by mid-2027. Passengers will enjoy free, ultra-fast internet at cruising altitude—streaming, gaming, video calling, and browsing seamlessly on both personal devices and seatback screens. The upgrade ensures every traveler experiences unmatched connectivity alongside Emirates’ premium cabins and extensive entertainment offeringsEmirates will begin equipping its in-service Boeing 777 aircraft with Starlink Wi-Fi in November 2025, completing the rollout across all aircraft by mid-2027. The airline’s 232-aircraft fleet will receive the installation over the next two years, with approximately 14 aircraft retrofitted each month.The first aircraft, A6-EPF, a Boeing 777-300ER, has already been fitted with Starlink and showcased at the Dubai Airshow, allowing visitors to experience the ultra-fast connectivity on the ground. The aircraft will enter commercial passenger service immediately after the Airshow, marking the official start of the fleet-wide rollout.Installation on the Airbus A380 fleet will begin in February 2026, featuring an industry-first setup of three antennae per aircraft to maximize connectivity, coverage, and capacity.Boeing 777 aircraft will receive two antennae each, ensuring consistent, high-quality Wi-Fi across all cabin classes.Starlink Wi-Fi on Emirates will be complimentary for all passengers, requiring only a single-click login, with no membership or payment needed. Once onboard, travelers will be able to:From late December 2025, Live TV over Starlink will also be available, initially on personal devices and later on seatback screens.This new connectivity is part of Emirates’ broader commitment to enhancing the inflight experience, complementing features like over 6,500 entertainment channels, the A380 Onboard Lounge, and the First Class Shower Spa.Sir Tim Clark, President of Emirates Airline, emphasized the airline’s dedication to consistent, high-quality experiences across its fleet:“Partnering with Starlink is another defining moment in our continuous commitment to ensuring our customers ‘fly better’. Starlink brings the world’s fastest Wi-Fi to our passengers, enabling productivity, communication, and entertainment at cruising altitude.”Clark highlighted that the Starlink rollout coincides with Emirates’ largest cabin refurbishment programme in aviation history, which includes:The airline has already refurbished 76 aircraft, integrating these new cabins and elevated finishes, with nearly 220 aircraft slated for retrofit under this programme.Chad Gibbs, VP of Starlink Business Operations at SpaceX, added:“With Starlink onboard Emirates flights, passengers will have the same seamless experience they enjoy on the ground, whether streaming, gaming, or video calling. We’re proud to support Emirates’ rapid Starlink installation while maintaining service quality.”By combining ultra-fast, complimentary Wi-Fi with premium cabin upgrades and extensive entertainment options, Emirates aims to set a new standard for global aviation. The rollout ensures that every passenger, on any aircraft or route, can experience the airline’s most advanced connectivity and onboard amenities.
Article Summary: Emirates will begin equipping its in-service boeing 777 aircraft with starlink wi-fi in november 2025, completing the rollout across all aircraft by mid-2027. The airline’s 232-aircraft fleet will receive the installation over the next two years, with approximately 14 aircraft retrofitted each month.

Article Title: Dubai Crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan’s net worth 2025: A glimpse at his palaces, yachts and lavish lifestyle
Article Text:
Dubai crown Prince Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum/ via Instagram

Saudi Crown Prince Defies Trump Pressure, Refuses Israel Ties Without Palestinian Statehood Roadmap - Report

Sheikh Hamdan's personal wealth: Breaking down his assets

Personal Investments: Sheikh Hamdan has made considerable investments in real estate and commercial ventures, particularly in the luxury property market, through his former company Zabeel Investments , which was once a major player in Dubai's real estate sector before its assets were absorbed by the Dubai Real Estate Corporation in 2013.



Sheikh Hamdan has made considerable investments in real estate and commercial ventures, particularly in the luxury property market, through his former company , which was once a major player in Dubai's real estate sector before its assets were absorbed by the Dubai Real Estate Corporation in 2013. Government and Royal Role : As Crown Prince and a key member of the royal family, his wealth is also supported by his various leadership roles and government responsibilities, including his position as Chairman of the Dubai Executive Council and his involvement in significant urban developments.



: As Crown Prince and a key member of the royal family, his wealth is also supported by his various leadership roles and government responsibilities, including his position as Chairman of the Dubai Executive Council and his involvement in significant urban developments. Luxury Assets: In addition to his investments, Sheikh Hamdan owns luxurious superyachts, private jets, exotic cars, and valuable art collections, all of which contribute significantly to his wealth profile.

Sheikh Hamdan’s super yachts and private jets



Superyacht collection: Quattroelle and Smeralda





Quattroelle : One of the most luxurious yachts in the world, Quattroelle boasts a gymnasium designed by Usain Bolt , multiple pools, and a spa with a hairdressing salon. The yacht is equipped with cutting-edge technology and can accommodate up to 16 guests with a crew of 29, offering an unparalleled luxury experience. Its estimated value is $180 million, with annual running costs around $18 million.



: One of the most luxurious yachts in the world, Quattroelle boasts a gymnasium designed by , multiple pools, and a spa with a hairdressing salon. The yacht is equipped with cutting-edge technology and can accommodate up to 16 guests with a crew of 29, offering an unparalleled luxury experience. Its estimated value is $180 million, with annual running costs around $18 million. Smeralda: Another addition to his collection is the 77-meter yacht Smeralda, known for its sleek design and opulent interiors.



Another addition to his collection is the 77-meter yacht Smeralda, known for its sleek design and opulent interiors. Other Yachts: Sheikh Hamdan also owns Quattroelle's support ship, the Quattroelle Shadow, as well as the Dubai, Dubawi, and Esmeralda yachts.





Luxury cars

Ferraris (including the LaFerrari)



Lamborghinis

Bugatti Veyron Grand Sport Vitesse



Golden Mercedes and other rare, customized vehicles





Royal residences and real estate assets

Zabeel Palace : The heart of his royal estate, Zabeel Palace is a grand royal residence and an architectural masterpiece. The palace is adorned with golden marble interiors and lush gardens, and serves as both a private residence and a venue for state receptions. Its value is priceless, symbolising Dubai's luxury and wealth.





: The heart of his royal estate, Zabeel Palace is a grand royal residence and an architectural masterpiece. The palace is adorned with golden marble interiors and lush gardens, and serves as both a private residence and a venue for state receptions. Its value is priceless, symbolising Dubai's luxury and wealth. Private Mansions: In addition to his palace, Sheikh Hamdan owns several private mansions in exclusive areas of Dubai, including Nad Al Sheba. These private residences feature state-of-the-art amenities such as private cinemas, equestrian stables, and luxurious outdoor spaces.

Notable projects





Tiara Residence ( Palm Jumeirah ) : A premium luxury residential tower on Dubai’s iconic Palm Jumeirah, estimated at over $600 million. The development offers high-end apartments with private amenities, stunning views, and exclusive facilities for residents.

: A premium luxury residential tower on Dubai’s iconic Palm Jumeirah, estimated at over $600 million. The development offers high-end apartments with private amenities, stunning views, and exclusive facilities for residents. Tiara United Towers : A mixed-use development featuring residential, commercial, and retail spaces, valued at approximately $450 million.

: A mixed-use development featuring residential, commercial, and retail spaces, valued at approximately $450 million. Other Mansion Compounds and Hospitality Assets: Sheikh Hamdan also owns multiple private estates and luxury hotel/resort holdings across Dubai, collectively estimated between $200 million and $300 million. These properties feature spacious gardens, equestrian facilities, swimming pools, and private cinema rooms, blending privacy with luxury.



A private royal zoo and wildlife conservation efforts





Sheikh Hamdan bin Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the Crown Prince of Dubai, is not just a figurehead of royalty—he is a man of extraordinary wealth, influence, and interests. With an estimated personal net worth ranging from $1 billion to $2 billion, Sheikh Hamdan is one of the wealthiest and most influential royals in the world. This fortune is drawn from a variety of sources, including luxurious real estate, superyachts, private jets, and rare car collections. However, these estimates often focus only on his personal assets, and his actual wealth is likely far greater when considering his family's assets and the extensive holdings tied to the Al Maktoum family.In fact, some reports generally estimate that the Al Maktoum family, led by Sheikh Hamdan's father, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, has a net worth that ranges between $14 billion to $18 billion, a figure that is widely cited but likely underestimates the full scale of their wealth. In reality, due to the notably private nature of royal assets and the discreetly managed lack of public disclosures, the family's true wealth could be potentially much higher than these estimates.Sheikh Hamdan's personal net worth, estimated between $1 billion and $2 billion, is significant but only scratches the surface of his family's total wealth. His fortune is tied to a combination of private investments, his role as Crown Prince, and assets across various industries. Below is a breakdown of his key wealth sources:Sheikh Hamdan’s love for luxury yachts is well known, and he is the proud owner of several high-end vessels:In addition to his yachts, Sheikh Hamdan has access to private jets and notably, a Boeing 747-400 from the Dubai Royal Air Wing, valued between $100 million to $270 million, offering luxurious interiors for personal and official traveSheikh Hamdan is renowned for his collection of luxury cars, many of which are limited-edition supercars. His garage reportedly includes:Along with his love for high-performance sports cars, Sheikh Hamdan has an affinity for luxury SUVs, particularly the Mercedes AMG G63, which is said to be his favourite vehicle.Sheikh Hamdan’s wealth extends far beyond cars and yachts; he is also deeply invested in real estate. His properties span Dubai and include:Sheikh Hamdan’s wealth is not confined to personal residences; his real estate investments form a substantial part of his overall fortune. Through Zabeel Investments and other holdings, he has acquired a mix of luxury residential towers, commercial developments, mansion compounds, and hospitality assets. These investments reflect both his personal tastes for opulence and his strategic role in shaping Dubai’s urban and economic landscape.This estimate combines his official residences, private estates, high-value real estate projects, and luxury lifestyle assets such as superyachts and jets. While these numbers provide a snapshot of Sheikh Hamdan’s tangible wealth, his actual financial influence and holdings likely extend far beyond these figures, particularly when considering his family’s overall fortune and the value of assets tied to the Al Maktoum dynasty.Sheikh Hamdan’s love for animals is well known, and he compassionately maintains an exclusive private zoo separate from Zabeel Palace. Located near Nad Al Sheba and close to the serene Dubai Desert Conservation Reserve, this private zoo houses a remarkably diverse collection of exotic animals, including white lions, giraffes, elephants, and tigers. The zoo is carefully and meticulously designed with state-of-the-art facilities, including specialized veterinary care and spacious habitats tailored to support the thriving needs of the animals.In addition to his exotic collection, Sheikh Hamdan is a passionate falconer, preserving and promoting falconry—a treasured Emirati heritage sport. He owns a private falconry centre equipped with a specialized falcon hospital, providing surgeries, X-rays, and emergency care for his prized birds. The Crown Prince actively participates in falconry competitions such as the Fazza Championship for Falconry and supports international exhibitions, showcasing his commitment to sustaining this centuries-old tradition.Sheikh Hamdan frequently shares rare glimpses of his animal kingdom and falconry pursuits on Instagram, where his 17 million+ followers see him interacting playfully with elephants, giraffes, lions, and majestic falcons. These posts highlight not only his love for wildlife but also his active role in conservation and cultural preservation efforts.
Article Summary: Sheikh hamdan has made considerable investments in real estate and commercial ventures, particularly in the luxury property market. His wealth is also supported by his leadership roles and government responsibilities, including his position as chairman of the dubai executive council.

Article Title: QTCinderella faces backlash after Jasontheween nomination clips spark criticism from xQc and Asmongold
Article Text:
QTCinderella faces backlash after Jasontheween nomination clips spark criticism from xQc and Asmongold (Image Via Getty)

Jasontheween clip choice triggers online debate as creators speak out





QTCinderella is facing a big wave of backlash after announcing the nominees for The Streamer Awards 2025 on November 16, 2025, during a livestream on Twitch. She revealed more than 35 categories, including “Best Just Chatting Streamer,” “Best VTuber,” and “Streamer of the Year. ” The list included many well-known creators such as Jasontheween from FaZe Clan, IShowSpeed, and Kai Cenat. This event is one of the largest fan-driven shows in the streaming world, so many viewers were watching closely as every category was revealed.But soon after QTCinderella finished her livestream, the online reaction turned negative. The problem started with the clips used for Jasontheween’s nominations. Fans on X said the clips felt strange and uncomfortable, especially because they showed him with two different creators he had partnered with in the past. Many viewers felt the choice of clips was disrespectful, and this quickly grew into a much bigger debate about how the awards were handled.Jasontheween worked with influencer Shizuku in early 2025, and their fans often joked about the pair becoming a couple. But that never happened, and months later, Jason began appearing with Sakura Shymko.They created several viral moments in mid-2025, and Sakura later confirmed they were in a relationship.Viewers were surprised when QTCinderella used a clip of Jason with Shizuku and then immediately placed a clip of him with Sakura for his “Best Just Chatting Streamer” nomination.Jasontheween reacted right away on stream. He said, “Are you deada** QT? I got a whole girlfriend. What the actual fk? Who put these clips together, bro?” His comments spread fast across social media on November 16, 2025.Later that night, QTCinderella responded in a very emotional livestream and said, “You’re so fking mad about one clip… Don’t support my f**king show then. Don’t vote for him… We’re doing our best.”More creators joined the conversation. Asmongold accused QTCinderella of “lying,” saying she picked nominees to keep sponsors happy.Felix “xQc” Lengyel also said the awards felt biased, especially after seeing Vanillamace nominated for “Best Breakout Streamer.”Also Read: IShowSpeed Leaves Viewers Stunned After DNA Results Uncover Shocking Truth About His Real Heritage And Identity He said QTCinderella may have added her because of their past drama. Kick streamer Adin Ross also said the awards were “not fan-voted,” pointing out that some names were unfamiliar to many viewers.Political commentator HasanAbi also added that he was surprised not to be nominated, since he believed 2025 was his most “impactful” year of streaming.
Article Summary: Qtcinderella announced nominees for the streamer awards 2025 on november 16, 2025. She revealed more than 35 categories, including “best just chatting streamer’ and “streamer of the year” the list included many well-known creators such as jasontheween, ishowspeed, and kai cenat.

Article Title: RaKai gets banned on Twitch again as viewers question his livestream behavior
Article Text:
RaKai gets banned on Twitch again as viewers question his livestream behavior (Image Via Getty)

RaKai’s livestream actions spark online guesses after Twitch suspension







RaKai, who is known online as “2xRaKai,” has been banned from Twitch for the third time. The news came out on November 17, 2025, when the automated account @StreamerBans on X posted that Twitch had suspended his channel again. RaKai is a close friend of streamer Kai Cenat and often appears in videos with him. This new suspension quickly grabbed attention because RaKai is only 16 years old and already has a long list of bans.Soon after the news spread, fans began talking about the suspension on X. People started sharing their own ideas about what happened during his live stream and why Twitch removed his account again. Many viewers said they saw some moments on his stream that might have caused the latest ban.Fans on X shared many different thoughts about what RaKai did on his stream on November 17, 2025. One user named @mrgodo54 wrote that he believed RaKai “humped the camera” and also used a firework indoors, which can break Twitch rules.Another user, @yoxics, posted that RaKai was banned because he “lit fireworks in his room” during his live broadcast. A third user, @CloverboysLIVE, who follows RaKai closely, said that RaKai was already trying to get unbanned and would return to streaming “once the ban gets lifted.”Some fans also mentioned another clip involving a device. One user, @SamPromise28, asked if this ban happened because RaKai was “dry humping the camera.”Another person, @KNavikay, said the “fire gun” he used is meant only for adults, which could be the reason for the ban. Many viewers reacted strongly, with one user, @racing_dun45939, saying the ban was deserved and asking Twitch to keep him off the platform longer.Twitch streamer Tylil James spoke to his viewers on the same day, November 17, 2025, to explain the situation. He said RaKai was only serving a one-day suspension and told fans not to worry.Also Read: IShowSpeed Leaves Viewers Stunned After DNA Results Uncover Shocking Truth About His Real Heritage And Identity Tylil said, “The ban is going to be uplifted tomorrow. He will be streaming tomorrow. You have nothing to worry about.” His message helped calm RaKai’s community, who had been asking questions since the news came out.This is not RaKai’s first time facing a Twitch ban. On June 17, 2025, he was banned after a video went viral showing him driving a car recklessly during a live stream. That earlier suspension also made headlines on social media.
Article Summary: 2xrakai has been banned from twitch for the third time. The news came out on november 17, 2025, when the automated account @streamerbans on x posted that twitch had suspended his channel again. This new suspension quickly grabbed attention because rakai is only 16 years old and already has a long list of bans.

Article Title: After a 3-year ban, SteveWillDoIt is finally back — Here’s what we know so far
Article Text:
Image Via "X"

After a 3-year ban, SteveWillDoIt is finally back with major comeback plans





SteveWillDoIt’s long-awaited return to YouTube has officially become reality, marking the end of a three-year absence that left one of the platform’s most talked-about creators sidelined. His original channel was permanently removed in August 2022 due to repeated violations of YouTube’s Community Guidelines, primarily involving gambling-related promotions. In the years since, Steve stayed active on Instagram and Kick, but the void on YouTube, his biggest stage, has remained a major talking point among fans. Now, with a comeback date set for December 24 at 8:30 PM ET, anticipation is running higher than ever as he steps back into the spotlight.His return doesn’t just mark a new upload; it marks a new era. Steve admitted that the past three years were emotionally brutal, saying he had been depressed and felt he had lost his purpose without YouTube. The announcement has reignited his massive fanbase, and his new channel, currently blank with no videos or profile photo, is already attracting heavy traffic from viewers hoping to witness his next big chapter unfold.The core of SteveWillDoIt’s return revolves around two major things: the impact of his ban and the massive scale of his comeback plans. His original removal from the platform stemmed from YouTube flagging multiple instances of gambling promotion, including unblurred URLs to betting sites. The termination hit Steve harder than many realized, as he later shared that YouTube was his life's passion, and losing the channel left him directionless.Now, he’s aiming to come back bigger than ever. Steve revealed that once his new channel hits one million subscribers, he will give away one million dollars to one single person, a signature blend of chaos and generosity that defined his earlier rise. He’s kicking things off with a Christmas special, followed by what he describes as a full TV show experience. This signals not just a return, but an expansion of his creative ambitions and production scale.SteveWillDoIt’s comeback is shaping up to be one of the biggest creators returns the platform has seen in years. From overcoming a difficult three-year ban to teasing high-budget content and massive giveaways, he’s stepping back into YouTube with renewed purpose and fan-driven momentum. With his first upload scheduled for December 24, all eyes are on the blank new channel that’s already generating buzz, and if history is any indication, his return may just break the internet again.Also Read: QTCinderella faces backlash as Asmongold and Tectone question fairness of the streamer awards
Article Summary: After a 3-year ban, stevewilldoit is finally back with major comeback plans. His original channel was permanently removed in august 2022 due to repeated violations of youtube’s community guidelines. Steve admitted that the past three years were emotionally brutal, saying he had been depressed and felt he had lost his purpose without youtube.

Article Title: PhysicsWallah IPO: Shares list with strong gains; should buy, sell or hold?
Article Text:
Representative image

(Disclaimer: Recommendations and views on the stock market, other asset classes or personal finance management tips given by experts are their own. These opinions do not represent the views of The Times of India)

PhysicsWallah made a strong entry into the stock market on Tuesday, with its shares rising sharply above the issue price and prompting immediate debate among investors over whether to buy, sell or hold.As per ET, the stock opened at Rs 145 on the NSE, about 33 per cent higher than its IPO price of Rs 109.On the BSE, it began trading at Rs 143.10, up 31 per cent, before climbing further to touch Rs 162.05 during the day.Company’s market value reached Rs 43,453 crore.Analysts said the upbeat debut reflects investor confidence in the edtech firm’s brand presence and hybrid teaching model.Shivani Nyati of Swastika Investmart was quoted by ET as saying that the company’s “strong brand recall, affordable test-prep offerings, and fast-growing hybrid model” had contributed to the strong listing.She added that PhysicsWallah benefits from a loyal student base, a broad exam portfolio and a scalable digital content system, though she warned of risks from larger rivals, regulatory uncertainty and profitability pressures.Nyati suggested that allottees may consider booking some profits while keeping part of their holdings for medium-term gains, with a stop-loss at Rs 130.The Rs 3,480–3,481 crore IPO — one of the largest from India’s edtech space — drew nearly twice the subscription by the final day, reported PTI and ET.The offer comprised a fresh issue of about Rs 3,100 crore and a Rs 380 crore offer for sale. QIBs drove demand with 2.86 times subscription, while retail interest stood at 1.14 times and non-institutional bidding was relatively soft.Employees subscribed 3.71 times, supported by a Rs 10 discount.Ahead of the IPO, the company raised Rs 1,563 crore from anchor investors, whose shares remain locked in until mid-December and mid-February.Founded by Alakh Pandey and Prateek Boob, PhysicsWallah has grown from a YouTube channel into a major edtech brand, with 13.7 million subscribers, 4.46 million paid learners and over 300 centres as of June 2025, according to ET.In FY25, revenue rose 51 per cent to Rs 3,039 crore and the company posted a net profit of Rs 243 crore after a loss in FY24. It remains loss-making in cumulative terms and reported a Rs 127 crore loss in Q1 FY26.As per news agency PTI, funds from the IPO will support expansion, technology upgrades, infrastructure and acquisitions.Brokerages offered mixed views before listing. Incred Equities recommended “Subscribe”, citing strong growth in both online and offline segments despite stretched valuations.SBI Securities took a neutral stance, while Swastika Investmart advised avoiding the issue.Analysts cautioned that although the debut was strong, modest subscription levels, competitive pressures and uneven profitability could lead to volatility once the initial excitement settles.PhysicsWallah is the first major pure-play edtech company to list on Indian exchanges, marking a milestone for the sector, reported PTI.
Article Summary: Physicswallah is the first major pure-play edtech company to list on indian exchanges. The rs 3,480–3,481 crore ipo drew nearly twice the subscription by the final day. Qibs drove demand with 2.86 times subscription, while retail interest stood at 1.14 times.
